description: Wild ginger (Asarum canadense) is an amazing plant species known for its glossy, bright green leaves and lovely bell-shaped flowers. Native to North America, it makes an excellent ground cover and is surprisingly hardy. In addition to its attractiveness, it also has a subtle flavor, making it prized as a culinary herb. It's a great choice for beginner gardeners as it doesn't require much maintenance or care and grows well in many different soil types. It's a beneficial plant to wildlife, offering shelter, food and nesting materials for birds, mammals and insects. Wild ginger is definitely worth growing - it adds natural beauty and flavor to any garden.
